pullrequest.title: Update ignition dependencies on Gazebo9 on Windows

content.raw:
I think the dependencies are correct. I added one more in 2b4524b.

I had to modify a few things on the instructions to build gzclient and gzserver successfully.

  * I had to set/modify  the `WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR` and `PATH` environment variables. For the `PATH`, I did this:
     - `set PATH=%WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\bin;%WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\lib;%PATH%`
  * Copy boost into the install dir. I copied the command from a CI build script:
      - `xcopy %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\boost_1_67_0\boost %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\include\boost /s /i /e /y `
      -  `xcopy %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\boost_1_67_0\lib64-msvc-14.1 %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\lib /s /i /e /y`
  * The install locations for all of the packages was `%WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%` instead of `gz-ws/<package name>/build/install/Release`
  * Skip ign-fuel-tools

Unfortunately, even though I could run `gzserver --help` and get an output, when I tried to run with a world file, it would just freeze. Since this PR is about updating dependencies, I will go ahead and approve. I was going to create an issue for it, but there are a couple open already.
content.html:
I think the dependencies are correct. I added one more in 2b4524b.

I had to modify a few things on the instructions to build gzclient and gzserver successfully.

  • I had to set/modify the WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR and PATH environment variables. For the PATH, I did this:
    • set PATH=%WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\bin;%WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\lib;%PATH%
  • Copy boost into the install dir. I copied the command from a CI build script:
    • xcopy %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\boost_1_67_0\boost %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\include\boost /s /i /e /y
    • xcopy %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\boost_1_67_0\lib64-msvc-14.1 %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR%\lib /s /i /e /y
  • The install locations for all of the packages was %WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR% instead of gz-ws/<package name>/build/install/Release
  • Skip ign-fuel-tools

Unfortunately, even though I could run gzserver --help and get an output, when I tried to run with a world file, it would just freeze. Since this PR is about updating dependencies, I will go ahead and approve. I was going to create an issue for it, but there are a couple open already.

content.raw:
I made some progress by installing all the libraries to `gz-ws`. I think the key was setting the same `DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` for all of them. However, I now have a different error with ign-msgs.
```
--ignmsgs_out: protoc-gen-ignmsgs: Plugin failed with status code 3221225781.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'C:\Users\User\Documents\code\gz-ws\bin\protoc.exe' : return code '0x1'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.24.28314\bin\HostX64\x64\nmake.exe"' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.24.28314\bin\HostX64\x64\nmake.exe"' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
```
content.html:
I made some progress by installing all the libraries to gz-ws. I think the key was setting the same DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX for all of them. However, I now have a different error with ign-msgs.

--ignmsgs_out: protoc-gen-ignmsgs: Plugin failed with status code 3221225781.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: 'C:\Users\User\Documents\code\gz-ws\bin\protoc.exe' : return code '0x1'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.24.28314\bin\HostX64\x64\nmake.exe"' : return code '0x2'
Stop.
NMAKE : fatal error U1077: '"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.24.28314\bin\HostX64\x64\nmake.exe"' : return code '0x2'

content.raw:
I'm having a few issues with building this:

1. I had to go into `build` before running `nmake`
1. This ended up installing to `C:\` instead of `gz-ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release`. It looks like WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR is not set in the `configure.bat` of ign-cmake, which is used to set `DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX`
1. I tried running cmake with `DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` set to `gz-ws\install` and the build and install worked, but when I tried to build ign-math, it couldn't find ign-cmake. I also tried setting it to `gz-ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release`, but no luck.
content.html:
I'm having a few issues with building this:

  1. I had to go into build before running nmake
  2. This ended up installing to C:\ instead of gz-ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release. It looks like WORKSPACE_INSTALL_DIR is not set in the configure.bat of ign-cmake, which is used to set DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX
  3. I tried running cmake with DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX set to gz-ws\install and the build and install worked, but when I tried to build ign-math, it couldn't find ign-cmake. I also tried setting it to gz-ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release, but no luck.
